title: crypto4coffee.store
author: crypto4coffee.store
content: I have recently launched a website/online store that sells coffee...but can only purchase with crypto.  the idea being people can participate in a use case with crypto.  i think the goal for many is that bitcoin becomes a world currency used in everyday activity...so this is a place to make that happen.  im looking for opinions of the site, ideas for best way to market to this community, and of course sales  please check it out!   Crypto4coffee.store

comments.author: moneystery
comments.body: your idea is quite good to build a website that focuses on selling coffee using crypto as the main payment method. but after looking at your website and trying to order, it seems you only accept payments via coinbase and within the us only? i think it will be quite difficult for you to run a business like this because not many people want to pay for crypto through their coinbase account and your reach is also in the us only. maybe putting more payment options and international shipping could be a good option.and there are still many parts that you need to put on your website, such as photos, real locations (if any), and videos, which explain the taste and appearance of the coffee you offer. so that potential buyers can be confident about the coffee you want to sell to them.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: crypto4coffee.store on November 15, 2023, 01:43:12 PMI have recently launched a website/online store that sells coffee...but can only purchase with crypto.  the idea being people can participate in a use case with crypto.  i think the goal for many is that bitcoin becomes a world currency used in everyday activity...so this is a place to make that happen.  im looking for opinions of the site, ideas for best way to market to this community, and of course sales  please check it out!   Crypto4coffee.storeThis is a very nice idea and initiative. I think people that have alot of crypto will like to order a coffe with crypto since there is already a history relating coffee and bitcoin. Meanwhile, your idea of business is best fit for people you know in person. I mean real people with real location. I might be posting from a lake in the Chad which is thousand miles away from you, so I might not be of a help to you and your business.Ask your neighbourhood what they really want and how they want it. It is from there that you can improve your services.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Is your products just a placeholder? The price and pictures are similar, and I don't understand what's the difference between each of them other than the names. Maybe the coffee is different, but it is hard to tell if you don't put it up front unless I'm not part of your market. As of now, it just looks like you use popular influencer names to create your products.I second the opinion that targeting the global market is quite a stretch for your product. Even if the local coffee market don't accept crypto, I don't think they will go out of their way to use your service just because you accept BTC, especially if the shipping cost, taxes, et comes into question.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: 1st: (Assume I'm your customer) the packaging design isn't attractive at all, I can't differentiate between the existing variants. How do I ensure that you sent me the variant I ordered?2nd: question, is your product licensed? Some consumers in certain parts of the world are sometimes very resistant to unlicensed products.3rd: I agree with several other opinions above. Consumers don't really care about payment methods, so you have to highlight product advantages on your website. Also, I'm not sure about the target consumers globally, coffee isn't a rare commodity in almost all countries. I think you should start intense marketing only in your town.

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: You've clearly got talent to exploit, your site is clean, well done, funny, original and creative, well done.  However, I agree with what was said above:-either you have to develop your idea, work on your products (I agree that unique packaging inspires distrust as a consumer)-If you're interested, you can find out more on the forum. I think you'd have everything to gain, and so would your customers. Replacing the banking system with another banking system with a BTC aroma is unfortunately not going to help the cause.-or perhaps to position yourself in a market that's less saturated?lol in Europe, a lot of ecologists describe coffee as a source of enormous pollution (rightly or wrongly, I don't care as I don't drink coffee), I can just imagine them sweating in front of their screens with the BTC + coffee combo!  In any case, I sincerely think you should keep trying to do something in this way, you seem to be talented but IMHO you may have just chosen the wrong project. Wish you all the best!

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: You have a nice site there, but you need to fix the social media links. And would be nice if you added more information about the company like the location.I feel the price is high, $20 for a coffee bag is high for my local market, i used to pay $4 here in the local store, and is a great coffee. Another recommendation is to add Paypal, i know is great to give the options for the users to pay in Bitcoin, but to add Paypal you only need to install a plugin and you will open your doors to the Paypal market which is huge.

comments.author: crypto4coffee.store
comments.body: Thanks to everone that took the time to look at the site and for the comments and ideas!  i will be making some changes to the site based on your input.  i did not understand the reach of this forum.  sorry for the inability to process an international order.  i am focusing on the area i live, USA. aslo looking to create an nft for each bag of coffee sold, with random nfts being able to be used as rewards for free items.  this will tie the project to the blockchain and provide traceability.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: If you already have an activity, integrating Bitcoin will not be difficult. You need to use btcPaySERVER https://btcpayserver.org/ and then you will be able to easily accept and keep Bitcoin deposits, as I think that selling them would not be a smart idea. However, if you want to start from scratch and the project focuses only on I do not expect you to find activity in Bitcoin, especially if you consider it a main project and not a side project. The idea is nice and I hope you continue it, because it is good to find places to spend Bitcoin outside trading

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: crypto4coffee.store on November 18, 2023, 02:48:13 PMi am focusing on the area i live, USA. aslo looking to create an nft for each bag of coffee sold, with random nfts being able to be used as rewards for free items.  this will tie the project to the blockchain and provide traceability.  That's fine, but you probably need to make it clear that you focus on your area instead of international/national shipping. I don't think creating NFT is going to help with your project in one way or another. The community has a mixed feelings about it and I don't think it is a good way to tie your project with Bitcoin at all. If you want to monetize it further, you can offer other things such as merch or use payment system that don't cost a lot like what have been mentioned above. In short, there are other ways to interact more with the ecosystem other than printing NFT that has no value.
